v.v: Hear my prayer, Yahweh;
Do not hide your face from me in my time of trouble.
For my days pass away like smoke,
My heart is crushed, and I am like grass that has withered.
With my continual groaning,
I am like a pelican of the wilderness;
I lie awake like a solitary bird,
My enemies taunt me all day long;
I eat ashes like bread
Because of your raging anger,
My days are like a shadow that fades,
But you, Yahweh, live forever,
You will rise up and have mercy on Zion.
For your servants hold her stones dear
The nations will respect your name, Yahweh,
Yahweh will rebuild Zion
At that time, he will respond to the prayer of the destitute;
This will be written for future generations,
For he has looked down from the holy heights;
to hear the groaning of the prisoners,
Then men will proclaim the name of Yahweh in Zion
when the peoples and kingdoms gather together
He has taken away my strength in the middle of life.
I said, “My God, do not take me away in the middle of life;
In ancient times you set the earth in place;
They will perish, but you will remain;
But you are the same,
The children of your servants will live on,

v: hear my cry to you.
Listen to me.
When I call out to you, answer me quickly.
and my bones burn like fire.
I forget to eat any food.
I have become very thin.
I have become like an owl in the ruins.
alone on the housetop.
those who mock me use my name in curses.
and mix my drink with tears.
you have lifted me up to throw me down.
and I have withered like grass.
and your fame is for all generations.
Now is the time to have mercy upon her;
the appointed time has come.
and feel compassion for the dust of her ruins.
and all the kings of the earth will honor your glory.
and will appear in his glory.
he will not reject their prayer.
and a people not yet born will praise Yahweh.
from heaven Yahweh has viewed the earth,
to release those who were condemned to death.
and his praise in Jerusalem
to serve Yahweh.
He has shortened my days.
you are here throughout all generations.
the heavens are the work of your hands.
they will all grow old like a garment;
like clothing, you will remove them, and they will disappear.
and your years will have no end.
and their descendants will live in your presence.”
